title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 June 2016 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
04:30 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
04:47 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
05:13 <MasterPiece> has quit  
06:04 <boubou> has quit  
06:08 <boubou> has joined #xwiki  
08:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <polx> Hello fellow developers, what’s the best practice for me to write a component (and extension…) that enriches the display of attachments with dedicated editors?  
08:24 <polx> (I know of JS, of course, and of a new skin but there must be a cleaner way, or?)  
08:45 <vmassol> polx: good morning  
08:45 <polx> Morning  
08:45 <vmassol> you mean do something special when someones clicks on an attachment (i.e. triggers the download action)?  
08:45 <vmassol> the only way I know of is to write an old style plugin  
08:46 <vmassol> (what the zipexplorer was doing if you need an example)  
08:46 <polx> I’ll see the zipexplorer.  
08:46 <polx> I want to add a button.  
08:47 <vmassol> that's different  
08:47 <vmassol> for this you could check the openoffice viewer  
08:47 <vmassol> if I remember correctly it's adding a button too  
08:47 <polx> but this is hard-coded, right?  
08:48 <polx> (this is in attachmentslist.vm indeed)  
08:49 <vmassol> indeed, bad  
08:49 <vmassol> so basically we're lissing an UIXP  
08:50 <vmassol> would be easy to add  
08:50 <vmassol> (see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/UIExtension+Module)  
08:50 <vmassol> s/lissing/missing  
08:51 <vmassol> to be able to contribute actions on an attachment  
08:52 <vmassol> you could start by creating a jira issue for this (and/or send a proposal email to the list)  
08:52 <polx> interesting indeed.  
08:52 <polx> so you mean I should make a proposal to wire the necessary bits for UIExtensions to be considered in attachmentslist, right?  
08:53 <vmassol> yes  
08:53 <polx> What would be the patch to attachmentslist.vm ?  
08:53 <vmassol> at least make sure we all agree  
08:53 <polx> sure  
08:53 <vmassol> then open a jira issue  
08:53 <vmassol> and then either create a PR or wait for someone to do it for you  
08:53 <vmassol> (with cajoling, bribing, etc you choose your way ;))  
08:53 <polx> I do not see how to do the patch yet but you mean I could count on someone to help or do it?  
08:54 <vmassol> yes  
08:54 <polx> Good. Sounds like a clean way to proceed.  
08:54 <polx> Thanks  
08:54 <vmassol> FTR there are plenty of examples  
08:54 <vmassol> and it's easy to do  
08:55 <vmassol> even a tutorial started here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/UIXTutorial  
08:55 <vmassol> some examples of existing uixp:http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/  
08:56 <polx> Any reason the tutorial is not mentioned from UIExtension+Module ?  
08:56 <vmassol> no good reason, you think you could ad it?  
08:56 <vmassol> :)  
08:56 <polx> I know I can, but I’ll need to read first.  
09:03 <polx> Oh, and another question: what’s the modern way to integrate a tool to produce standalone html within an extension? I know of a way to do it using xpage=plain but maybe defining a new “action” or even servlet is cleaner? Seems to me that hte first is the easiest.  
09:04 <vmassol> you mean introduce a new URL/action?  
09:05 <vmassol> (if so that would be http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Resource+API )  
09:05 <polx> A new action is a new URL indeed.  
09:05 <vmassol> example: webjar module  
09:05 <vmassol> (in platform)  
09:05 <vmassol> you'll find a ResourceReferenceHandler impl there  
09:06 <polx> So that’s the new action way. Isn’t that overcrowded?  
09:06 <vmassol> yes it's supposed to replace the old XWikiAction way  
09:06 <vmassol> so new actions we write use those while we still need to move the old ones to it  
09:07 <vmassol> not sure what you mean by overcrowded  
09:07 <polx> since there’s no namespacing…  
09:08 <vmassol> there's namespacing  
09:08 <vmassol> of course :)  
09:09 <polx> If you use /xwiki/bin/view/MyApp/LaunchEditor you have namespacing.  
09:09 <vmassol> that's the <type> in http://.../xwiki/<type>/<dependent on the type>  
09:09 <vmassol> and <type> happens to be the hint of your ResourceReferenceHandler component impl  
09:10 <vmassol> (in the standard URL scheme)  
09:17 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <polx> has quit  
09:25 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: good mornin  
09:49 <vmassol> morning  
09:49 <tmortagne> vmassol: good morning  
09:49 <vmassol> fyi, just left a comment for you in http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/ANTISPAM-25  
09:49 <vmassol> hope you had a good we! :)  
09:49 <tmortagne> vmassol: xwiki is not main wiki  
09:49 <tmortagne> wiki:xwiki is  
09:50 <vmassol> it used to work so maybe the format has changed  
09:50 <vmassol> ?  
09:50 <tmortagne> so right now this extension cannot be installed anywhere  
09:50 <tmortagne> but indeed the UI should not even propose to install it on farm  
09:50 <tmortagne> the format did not changed  
09:50 <tmortagne> this is a namespace list so no way "xwiki" ever worked  
09:51 <tmortagne> checking why the UI propose install on farm  
09:51 <vmassol> fixing  
09:51 <vmassol> (on the antispam side)  
09:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: does it really requires to be on main wiki ?  
09:58 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> I don't recall why but yes it was done on purpose  
09:59 <vmassol> it probably fails when installed on subwikis  
10:00 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/ANTISPAM-12  
10:00 <vmassol> not very clear description ;)  
10:01 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <tmortagne> seems to be mostly about making sure there will be only one listener  
10:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't reproduce the "install on farm" button on master, maybe a 8.1 bug that I fixed  
10:08 <tmortagne> I don't get any button for antispan 1.5  
10:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm running a 8.1 which is probably 5-6 days old so could be  
10:08 <tmortagne> you means a master ?  
10:09 <vmassol> sorry  
10:09 <vmassol> yes I mean master  
10:09 <tmortagne> ok, 6 days old is not old enough to have a difference IMO, did not worked on extensions for a while  
10:10 <vmassol> a bit more, 5th of June apparently  
10:10 <vmassol> grrrr  
10:10 <vmassol> Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-deploy-plugin:2.8.2:deploy (default-deploy) on project application-antispam-simple: Failed to deploy artifacts: Could not transfer artifact org.xwiki.contrib:application-antispam-simple:jar:1.5.1 from/to xwiki-staging (http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/service/local/staging/deploy/maven2/): nexus.xwiki.org:80 failed to respond -> [Help 1]  
10:10 <vmassol> nexus problems?  
10:11 <vmassol> hmm no seems I can log on it  
10:11 <tmortagne> according to aether javadoc the default timeout is 10 seconds  
10:12 <vmassol> yep  
10:12 <vmassol> that was it apparently  
10:12 <vmassol> worked on the second try  
10:15 <vmassol> ouch: https://www.evernote.com/l/AHcd2XFyujRKIJoQLhx5k0Isc35IcUQxBP4  
10:15 <vmassol> Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getParameters' in  class org.xwiki.uiextension.internal.WikiUIExtension threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at 1868:/skins/flamingo/view.vm[line 78, column 34]  
10:16 <vmassol> strangely a refresh fixes it  
10:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <cjd> has quit  
10:32 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:06 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <cjd> has quit  
12:24 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:07 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:09 <polx> has quit  
13:09 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
13:46 <polx> has quit  
13:55 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:30 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: "A better solution could be to allow to inject 2 (or more) documents using the ConfigurableClass mechanism."  
14:30 <vmassol> but that's already implemented, no?  
14:30 <vmassol> (I'm pretty sure it is)  
14:31 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration+Application#HWhathappensifIaddmorethanoneXWiki.ConfigurableClassobject3F  
14:32 <gdelhumeau> good  
14:32 <gdelhumeau> but we still lack the ability to add content to sections that are not using the configurableclass  
14:33 <vmassol> I've answered to that too  
14:33 <vmassol> in the issue  
14:33 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13494?focusedCommentId=91716&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-91716  
14:33 <vmassol> I'm a bit worried about mixing the 2 concepts  
14:33 <vmassol> which are both implementing the same needs in the end  
14:33 <vmassol> but using different ways  
14:35 <vmassol> note that you probably know more than I do on the topic since I haven't thought much about it; I'm just raising a potential issue that we need to answer  
14:35 <vmassol> (playinf the devil's advocate here)  
14:40 <sorinello> has quit  
14:43 <gdelhumeau> no you actually are right  
14:44 <gdelhumeau> I just started from adding a UIX in the Users Management, then decided to make it more generic, and finally re-implementing ConfigurableClass  
14:45 <gdelhumeau> I remember that at some point you wanted to get rid of ConfigurableClass since we have UIX  
14:45 <gdelhumeau> but I beleive you have changed your mind (a remember some debates on the ML about dropping UIX)  
14:45 <vmassol> I haven't decided yet but what I know  
14:45 <vmassol> is that we had a debate and kind of an agreement about when yo use UIXP and when not to  
14:46 <vmassol> and I probably made a mistake recently in the Tip Panel  
14:46 <vmassol> I need to re-read that discussion  
14:46 <vmassol> and we need to come to an agreement and document it as a best practice on xwiki.org  
14:46 <vmassol> problem is that I won't have the time to work on this before 10 days  
14:47 <vmassol> from what i remember UIXP should be reserved to templates and when using wiki pages, we should favor XClass but I don't remember the details  
14:50 <gdelhumeau> UIX was more "inject some code" and that's all, meanwhile XClass also adds specific and typed fields that could be used for doing more than that  
14:51 <gdelhumeau> ex: introduce a new item in a menu: UIX  
14:51 <gdelhumeau> describe an application so it can be listed in a list: XClass  
14:51 <gdelhumeau> even if at some point, the XClass could be used to inject code too  
14:53 <vmassol> the discussion regarding removing them was at http://markmail.org/message/ojgmy7pljzwjq7vp  
14:56 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <vmassol> so actually nobody answered to http://markmail.org/message/ewk4rq7p2mtqehto  
14:58 <vmassol> that's where we left the topic...  
14:58 <vmassol> and since then we've added lots of UIXPs ...  
15:01 <vmassol> would be great if the xwiki committers could reply to this last mail I had sent  
15:02 <vmassol> basically the idea would be to consider the UIExtensionClass (or another name) be a generic XClass used for a single purpose which is that of contributing content only  
15:02 <polx> has quit  
15:02 <vmassol> s/generic/specific  
15:05 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <polx> has quit  
15:17 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <D-Spair> has quit  
15:25 <mflorea> vmassol, tmortagne, Enygma`, evalica, quick poll: should I use UIExtension or custom XClass for wysiwyg editor extension point?  
15:26 <vmassol> :)  
15:26 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <vmassol> for the Edit menu?  
15:27 <evalica> I guess it would be an UIExtension, now you are talking about the listing in the content menu + profile settings.  
15:27 <mflorea> this is the extension point that outputs the wysiwyg editor (be it gwt or ck or another one)  
15:27 <evalica> +administration, so there are like 3 places where the editors will be listed / configured  
15:28 <vmassol> mflorea: the answer is simple according to the thread I pointed to  
15:28 <tmortagne> wysiwyg and editor in general you should be tied to xclasses IMO, they should be components be it UI extension or something else  
15:29 <vmassol> so basically you should use UIExtesnionClass (instead of a custom XClass) only if you need only content  
15:29 <vmassol> s/content/a content field  
15:29 <vmassol> in this case and only in this case, you could reuse the UIExtensionClass which is simply a specific XClass that can be used generically for this special use case  
15:30 <vmassol> at least that's what is at http://markmail.org/message/ewk4rq7p2mtqehto  
15:30 <vmassol> and what seems the common agreement so far (Caty, Sergiu, me)  
15:30 <tmortagne> UI extension are not just a "specific xclass"  
15:30 <tmortagne> there is one thing xclass are not is component  
15:31 <tmortagne> ui extension are components which mean you can implement them the way you want, including in a java component  
15:31 <mflorea> the main goal is to output the wysiwyg editor, but we can't know for sure that we won't need some parameters in the future. Do we change from UIExtension to XClass at that point?  
15:31 <vmassol> it's true for XClass too  
15:31 <vmassol> you can create them in java  
15:31 <tmortagne> IMO WYSIWYG should not be iu extension or XClass  
15:31 <tmortagne> I already described how I was seing editor component in another mail  
15:32 <vmassol> mflorea: yes there's always the upgrade issue and in this case it would require a migrator  
15:32 <mflorea> tmortagne: the wysiwyg editor is UI, it generates HTML, I don't want to generate HTML from Java  
15:32 <tmortagne> mflorea: it's UI but it does not have to be wiki page  
15:33 <tmortagne> it's not because it's a component that the implementation is fully in java  
15:33 <vmassol> mflorea: we could implement a generic XClass migrator at one point btw  
15:33 <evalica> mflorea: this is not a quick poll :) trickery  
15:33 <tmortagne> mflorea: as you know DW steps are component and they are implemented in templates  
15:34 <tmortagne> I see the same thing for editors  
15:34 <mflorea> tmortagne: dw is not an extension, it's not installable. the wysiwyg editor needs to be installable  
15:34 <tmortagne> it does not change anything  
15:34 <tmortagne> DW steps are components  
15:35 <tmortagne> they could come from an extension  
15:35 <tmortagne> the list of step is harcoded right now that's all  
15:35 <mflorea> how would the templates be installed?  
15:37 <mflorea> or do you mean using the templates from the jar?  
15:37 <tmortagne> OIDC have several templates, here is how it works:  
15:38 <tmortagne> \* it ask the template manager if there is any template named "oidc/provider/consent.vm"  
15:38 <tmortagne> \* if none it execute as template the resource file "/oidc/provider/consent.vm" which is the default implementation for this view  
15:40 <tmortagne> later we could easily add this fallback to resource file support right in template manager (but I needed to make oidc work on 7.4 anyway so I had to do it on my side for now)  
15:40 <tmortagne> anyway the important thing is that component is not an issue for UI, at all  
15:40 <tmortagne> it allows implementing it in a lot more way that XClass based extension points  
15:41 <tmortagne> simple XClass extension point that is  
15:41 <mflorea> it is, because it's not as easy to make changes at runtime, the dev feedback cycle is longer, same with webjars  
15:41 <tmortagne> mflorea: you skipped the first step  
15:41 <mflorea> I see  
15:41 <tmortagne> again during development you simple edit templates/oidc/provider/consent.vm  
15:42 <tmortagne> that's hat I did  
15:42 <mflorea> ok  
15:43 <tmortagne> \* wiki component  
15:43 <tmortagne> like UI extension xclass basically are helpers to make easier to implement UI extension component in a wiki pages  
15:43 <tmortagne> or wiki macros  
15:44 <tmortagne> the criteria is usually "do I want to be able to implement this kind of component without PR"  
15:44 <mflorea> tmortagne: what about the scope that the UI extensions have, atm we can't install a component (with EM) in the user namespace  
15:45 <mflorea> I mean from the UI  
15:46 <tmortagne> you mean allow any user to install an extension (not just admin) and in its own namespace ?  
15:46 <tmortagne> sure we could do that, it's not very complex  
15:47 <mflorea> I mean: an user might want to integrate another editor but without affecting the other users  
15:47 <tmortagne> this is not the same thing  
15:47 <tmortagne> I explain how to configure editors in my mail  
15:48 <mflorea> the issue is that the editor will be visible for others (in the list of editors to chooe from)  
15:48 <tmortagne> http://markmail.org/message/fxyeraknkcpbcgfg  
15:48 <tmortagne> here is the mail  
15:49 <tmortagne> I don't think making possible for only one user to see a WYSIWYG you installed  
15:49 <tmortagne> is a real use case  
15:50 <tmortagne> an admin install a new WYSIWYG, if you want to select it as your default WYSIWYG (or the admin indicate it's the default one from now on)  
15:51 <mflorea> I'm not talking about admin. An user wants to use some editor that he likes an for which there isn't any extension availble. He want to integrate it. He should be able to do this very easily  
15:52 <mflorea> it should be possible from the wiki, without jave  
15:52 <tmortagne> so you are talking about install an extension without admin right  
15:53 <tmortagne> not sure why you are talking about java here  
15:53 <mflorea> not install, integrate some third party editor  
15:53 <tmortagne> I already said you don't need to implement it in Java, you can implement it in Java  
15:53 <mflorea> like for instance I want to use a different date picker  
15:53 <tmortagne> the editor you are talking about has to come from somewhere  
15:54 <tmortagne> either it's already installed and you can select it in a list or it's not installed  
15:54 <mflorea> i.e. I want to customize my instance and I want to change the wysiwyg editor  
15:54 <mflorea> it's not installed, I want to integrate it  
15:54 <tmortagne> what means "integrate" ?  
15:54 <acotiuga> has quit  
15:55 <mflorea> it means I want to use it instead of the default editor  
15:55 <tmortagne> does it exist somewhere ? you say it's not installed but you want to magically "integrate" it so I don't understand what is it  
15:56 <tmortagne> for me as soon as you install an extension that contains an editor it become available in a list in which you can select it  
15:56 <mflorea> it exists somewhere on the web, it's some JavaScript+CSS files that I can load from some CDN or that I can copy to my instance or put in some JSX/SSX  
15:57 <tmortagne> depends on the kind of editor, etc.. (but would probably be more clear if you read the example I listed in my mail :))  
15:57 <mflorea> for instance I want to use this editor https://www.froala.com/wysiwyg-editor  
15:59 <mflorea> I'm not an admin and I want to use this editor instead of the default provided WYSIWYG editor  
15:59 <tmortagne> you are mixing several things here I think, a complete editor is handling some data, but then this editor could allow you to choose between several themes. For example the date editor you installed might allow you to choose between several calendar view or indicate another one  
15:59 <tmortagne> it's not all or nothing, you need to organize things in abstraction levels  
16:00 <mflorea> I'm not sure we're talking about the same thing  
16:01 <mflorea> when I download XWiki and edit some wiki page I get a wysiwyg editor. I, as a non-admin user, want to replace that editor, I want to use some other editor, like https://www.froala.com/wysiwyg-editor . First step is to check for existing XWiki extensions.  
16:01 <mflorea> I can't find anyone that integrates https://www.froala.com/wysiwyg-editor so I would like to integrate it myself  
16:01 <mflorea> but from the wiki, at runtime, without using Java  
16:01 <tmortagne> but you cannot just use it as it is, you need to build plumbing around it for it to properly talk with XWiki  
16:02 <mflorea> yes, but where would I put that plumbing?  
16:02 <tmortagne> so you are not a user, you are a developer writing a new editor ?  
16:04 <mflorea> I'm not a real developer, I just read the https://www.froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs and I see that I can use this editor with the help of some HTML/JS. Where can I put this HTML/JS so that I can replace the current wysiwyg editor  
16:04 <tmortagne> if your question is how do I provide an editor component in a XAR extension then I answered this with:  
16:04 <tmortagne> (03:43:37 PM) tmortagne: or wiki macros  
16:05 <mflorea> ok, so wiki component is the answer  
16:05 <tmortagne> so from this I guess the answer will be: you create a page with object EditorClass configured to be associated with WYSIWYG  
16:05 <tmortagne> wiki component is the answer we already have  
16:05 <tmortagne> but we can make it simpler  
16:05 <tmortagne> like we don't force people to write wiki component to provide wiki macros  
16:05 <mflorea> ok  
16:06 <tmortagne> the important things for me is that the root of the editor extension point is a component role  
16:06 <tmortagne> then from it we can build as many helpers as we want  
16:09 <mflorea> regarding this component role, and what you proposed on the mail, I'm not sure how Editor<String> would work. Imagine that there is an editor for CSS and one for JavaScript (just an example). We would need to add some CSS and JavaScript type so that we can use Editor<CSS> and Editor<JavaScript>  
16:11 <tmortagne> there is several choices  
16:16 <tmortagne> \* Editor<String> with @Named("<mimetype>")  
16:16 <tmortagne> \* probably other possibilities  
16:17 <mflorea> ok  
17:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> has joined #xwiki  
17:11 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> hello, I've just found out this: http://comments.gmane.org/gmane.comp.web.wiki.xwiki.user/28977  
17:11 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> is there an alternative solution without using Velocity?  
17:11 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> (our enterprise xwiki installation has velocity macros disabled)  
17:18 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:22 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> in other words, what would be the equivalent of $doc.documentReference as a node identifier? Something like document:xwiki:. ?  
17:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> has quit  
18:00 <Slashman> has quit
